channel.title: Unused / rarely used parts of the standard
channel.description:
The subheading on the [Exploring Data](http://dashboard.iatistandard.org/exploring_data.html) section of the IATI dashboard asks “Which parts of the IATI Standard are being used?”
After discovering `iati-activity/crs-add/channel-code` is unused ([here](https://discuss.iatistandard.org/t/updates-to-the-crschannelcode-codelist/797/8)), I was interested in which other parts aren’t being used / are rarely used.
Using [the data here](http://dashboard.iatistandard.org/elements.html) and the [v2.02 schema](https://github.com/IATI/IATI-Schemas/tree/version-2.02), [this script](https://gist.github.com/andylolz/6f532d2074c275859affb7210e0377e9) extracts the following:
## Unused elements
* [iati-activity/crs-add/channel-code](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/channel-code/) * [iati-activity/fss](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/fss/) * [iati-activity/fss/forecast](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/fss/forecast/) * [iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget/recipient-region/narrative](http://iatistandard.org/202/organisation-standard/iati-organisations/iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget/recipient-region/narrative/)
## Rarely used elements
* [iati-activity/planned-disbursement/provider-org/narrative](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/planned-disbursement/provider-org/narrative/) (used in 89 activities) * [iati-activity/planned-disbursement/receiver-org](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/planned-disbursement/receiver-org/) (used in 100 activities) * [iati-activity/planned-disbursement/receiver-org/narrative](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/planned-disbursement/receiver-org/narrative/) (used in 89 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/) (used in 2 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-type](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-type/) (used in 2 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-plan](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-plan/) (used in 2 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/commitment-date](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/commitment-date/) (used in 2 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-first-date](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-first-date/) (used in 2 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-final-date](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-final-date/) (used in 2 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/) (used in 17 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/interest-received](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/interest-received/) (used in 17 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/principal-outstanding](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/principal-outstanding/) (used in 17 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/principal-arrears](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/principal-arrears/) (used in 17 activities) * [iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/interest-arrears](http://iatistandard.org/202/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/interest-arrears/) (used in 17 activities) * [iati-organisation/total-budget/budget-line](http://iatistandard.org/202/organisation-standard/iati-organisations/iati-organisation/total-budget/budget-line/) (used in 54 organisation files) * [iati-organisation/total-budget/budget-line/value](http://iatistandard.org/202/organisation-standard/iati-organisations/iati-organisation/total-budget/budget-line/value/) (used in 53 organisation files) * [iati-organisation/total-budget/budget-line/narrative](http://iatistandard.org/202/organisation-standard/iati-organisations/iati-organisation/total-budget/budget-line/narrative/) (used in 52 organisation files) * [iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget](http://iatistandard.org/202/organisation-standard/iati-organisations/iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/) (used in 42 (used in 42 organisation files) * [iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/recipient-org/narrative](http://iatistandard.org/202/organisation-standard/iati-organisations/iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/recipient-org/narrative/) [iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/period-start](http://iatistandard.org/202/organisation-standard/iati-organisations/iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/period-start/) (used in 42 organisation files) * item.title: Unused / rarely used parts of the standard
item.dc:creator: andylolz
item.description:
YohannaLoucheur:

I wonder if part of the explanation may be that there’s default information already provided - hence no need to provide it in the particular element.

That’s no doubt the case for some elements. But here, I was more interested in ‘unnecessary’ than ‘under-used’ i.e. are there indications that some parts of the standard might be extraneous. Even for elements that override a default, I’d anticipate more occurrences.

YohannaLoucheur:

Also wonder about counting “activities” for the iati-organisation/ elements. Technically these would not show in “activites”. In this care are you counting the number of files (thus publishers) instead?

Ah! Yes, exactly – thanks. I’ve fixed this typo in the post above.

Read full topic
item.source: Unused / rarely used parts of the standard

item.title: Unused / rarely used parts of the standard
item.dc:creator: YohannaLoucheur
item.description:
Andy, thanks for sharing, it’s interesting.

For some of the “rarely used” category, I wonder if part of the explanation may be that there’s default information already provided - hence no need to provide it in the particular element. This came to mind regarding for instance the planned-disbursements/receiver-org, which in most cases is the same as the implementing org and the receiver-org for transactions etc. If it was possible to do some contextual analysis (ie counting only those activities where a given element would be expected), we’d get a more precise sense of how much specific elements are under-used - but I understand this may be too difficult to do and/no not worth the effort!

Also wonder about counting “activities” for the iati-organisation/ elements. Technically these would not show in “activites”. In this care are you counting the number of files (thus publishers) instead?

Read full topic
item.source: Unused / rarely used parts of the standard

item.title: Unused / rarely used parts of the standard
item.dc:creator: andylolz
item.description:
The subheading on the Exploring Data section of the IATI dashboard asks “Which parts of the IATI Standard are being used?”

After discovering iati-activity/crs-add/channel-code is unused (here), I was interested in which other parts aren’t being used / are rarely used.

Using the data here and the v2.02 schema, this script extracts the following:

Unused elements

  • iati-activity/crs-add/channel-code
  • iati-activity/fss
  • iati-activity/fss/forecast
  • iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget/recipient-region/narrative

Rarely used elements

  • iati-activity/planned-disbursement/provider-org/narrative (used in 89 activities)
  • iati-activity/planned-disbursement/receiver-org (used in 100 activities)
  • iati-activity/planned-disbursement/receiver-org/narrative (used in 89 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms (used in 2 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-type (used in 2 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-plan (used in 2 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/commitment-date (used in 2 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-first-date (used in 2 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-terms/repayment-final-date (used in 2 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status (used in 17 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/interest-received (used in 17 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/principal-outstanding (used in 17 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/principal-arrears (used in 17 activities)
  • iati-activity/crs-add/loan-status/interest-arrears (used in 17 activities)
  • iati-organisation/total-budget/budget-line (used in 54 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/total-budget/budget-line/value (used in 53 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/total-budget/budget-line/narrative (used in 52 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget (used in 42 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/recipient-org (used in 42 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/recipient-org/narrative (used in 18 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/period-start (used in 42 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/period-end (used in 42 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/value (used in 42 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/budget-line (used in 9 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/budget-line/value (used in 9 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-org-budget/budget-line/narrative (used in 8 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget (used in 4 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget/recipient-region (used in 4 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget/period-start (used in 4 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget/period-end (used in 4 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget/value (used in 4 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget/budget-line (used in 1 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget/budget-line/value (used in 1 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-region-budget/budget-line/narrative (used in 1 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-country-budget (used in 70 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-country-budget/recipient-country (used in 70 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-country-budget/recipient-country/narrative (used in 16 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-country-budget/period-start (used in 70 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-country-budget/period-end (used in 70 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-country-budget/value (used in 70 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-country-budget/budget-line (used in 11 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-country-budget/budget-line/value (used in 11 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/recipient-country-budget/budget-line/narrative (used in 11 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/total-expenditure (used in 14 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/total-expenditure/period-start (used in 14 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/total-expenditure/period-end (used in 14 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/total-expenditure/value (used in 14 organisation files)
  • iati-organisation/total-expenditure/expense-line (used in 9 organisation files)

  • iati-organisation/document-link/document-date (used in 43 organisation files)

item.source: Unused / rarely used parts of the standard
